The Under Secretary of State, Comiiionwealth Relations, internal Dept: Whitehall, S W.1. Dear Sir, Formation of a Bri 19th February, 1948 / ,iu pi 3 1 •; >.0 ish Legion Branch in Kuwait. When approached by individuals for permission to form Branches of the Legion in Overseas British Territories, it is our custom to confirm with the Government Dept., concerned that they have no objection to the fornation of such a Branch. In this connection, I write to say that we have to-day received a letter from an employee of the Kuwait Oil Company Limited, saying that there are some 200 British Ex Servicemen in the district with the prospect of many more entering the territory. In addition, there are a considerable number of native ex-service men. He is confident that the management of the Company will be pleased to help in the formation of the Branch, and before pursu ing this matter any further we should be much obliged if you could let us have your confirmation that you have no objection to such a formation. yours faithfully. Assistant Secretary.

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence regarding the proposed establishment of a new branch of the British Legion in Kuwait. The primary correspondents are: British Legion; Commonwealth Relations Office. The file includes a divider, which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
